website_summaries.verdict: Thoughtful design has lots of ability for cleaning large surfaces and getting into crannies.
pros: Extra-wide brush head helps cover a big surface area
Large stainless steel bristles are sturdy
Ergonomic 12" handle makes it easy to hold while cleaning
cons: Some users wish the handle was longer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on a Weber Q!
customer_reviews.text: This brush works great on my Weber Q grill and is probably the best grill brush I have ever owned. If you turn the brush on end it fits nicely in between the openings on the cast iron Weber grill grate. Only been using a month and have not lost bristles yet. I don't understand the complaints in the negative reviews. Maybe this Weber brush is designed specifically for Weber grills.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Ditzel

customer_reviews.title: I'm a big fan!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a grill brush that doesn't melt on me! I made the mistake on the first couple of grill brushes I bought by buying plastic. As obvious as it sounds to me now, most BBQ sets come with plastic grill brushes. These might work fine if you only brush a cold grill but we all know how effective that is. This brush lasted me three years and the only reason I bought a new one yesterday is because the old brush was so full of grease. These things are so cheap it was worth it for me to throw the old one away and replace it for $8.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grill brush
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality grill brush but Weber tends to make solid products. The actual brush is very sturdy and has lasted for quite a while now. I like that it feels really sturdy when I brush the grates vigorously. I probably will buy another one once this one gets worn out but that might be a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jun Tanega

customer_reviews.title: I've Had Better Brushes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush with some other Weber stuff due to my 5 year old brush breaking. This one has a smaller handle, and a very different shape. I prefer the style with just a square pad of bristles at the end of a long handle. I'll use it until it falls apart, but would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great grill brush!
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy and well made. During the pandemic when everyone was off or working reduced hours, I had small <10 people barbeques on a weekly basis for my kids and a couple of close friends. In addition, we use the grill 1-2 nights a week for ourselves. I have yet to see a single bristle come loose, and clean up is as easy as spraying the brush with hot water. The shape is perfect for cleaning large areas of the grill, and the corners are great for cleaning the ends of the opening. 100% worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Small but MIGHTY grill brush gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: The Weber 12 inch 3-sided grill brush is one nifty little product. I purchased it to use with my Weber Q 1200 portable grill. The grill brush is well-constructed and very sturdy. Plus the compact size makes it convenient to use and store. Granted, I think it would perform even better with a regular wire grill instead of the grated and plated grill that comes with the Q 1200. But even so, it still performed just as well as my old long-handled conventional grill brush, with a lot less effort. Definitely a quality grill brush.
customer_reviews.author: Big Game James

customer_reviews.title: The Best Grill Cleaner So Far
customer_reviews.text: I've used a couple of brush type grill cleaners. They never do a great job and the bristles always end up flatten towards the top of the brush where it gets the most action. And I've always been frustrated by a brush's inability to clean between the grates. The design of this brush is amazing. It cleans the top and in-between grates beautifully. Super fast, just a couple of wipes back and forth and everything is clean. Love it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: House Wife

customer_reviews.title: About perfect....
customer_reviews.text: After requiring a new BBQ, I purchased a Weber and am very pleased with the purchase. I needed a brush to clean the grill and this was the best option. Like the Weber grill, this is a high quality brush and does the job super well. I am very pleased with the sturdiness of the brush and the way it really does a great job of cleaning the grill as it is supposed to. A very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Narut Ujnat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shape for grate scrubbing, works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Perfect brush for the nastiest grill grates. Gets easily in between every inch. Sturdy and strong, it cleaned a terribly rusty, cooked on grease grate set beautifully. I only use the brush with the grates removed where I can completely hose down and wipe off, so as not to have to worry about any loose bristles sticking to food. 2 hard uses so far, and I didn't see any that had gotten loose or fallen out.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill Brush
customer_reviews.text: This is a great brush that easily gets between the grates on our Weber gas grill. I bought it as it recommended by America's Test Kitchen. The handle is quite short and you'll want to work quickly over a hot grate, but I have similar brushes with longer handles and you just can't get the same amount of leverage as with this sturdy one. This was my second purchase as with any wire brush, it will need to be replaced eventually. The brush also arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: metal and grime will wear down the brush after a good summers worth of use and abuse
customer_reviews.text: i grill a lot during the summer and i abuse all my grill tools, this one being no exception. the heat, metal and grime will wear down the brush after a good summers worth of use and abuse. it'll do the job and well, scraping and cleaning the grill, but don't expect it to last past 1 yr (if you grill a lot). would appreciate thicker brush, metal frame and more heat resistant handle, but probably would be more expensive. pros - price, does job. cons - won't last, handle too short, brushes and metal frame will start to bend and get out of shape.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Weber Gas Grill
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other brands of brushes but this one has worked better than any of the others. It's too soon to know about durability, but I'm hopeful. My cast iron grids are reversible--wider on one side and narrower on the other. This brush works fine for either side. Glad I have it a try.
customer_reviews.author: CTinOC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Metal brushes detach after light use
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on this hoping to avoid a bristle brush, but, after seeing the review on America's Test Kitchen, I decided to give this one a go. So far, with light use, two bristles have come off. We've had it for a couple of weeks. That is with very light cleaning on a Weber grill. The metal pieces are pretty large, would not end up in your food - or if they do - you'd certainly see them, but certainly not satisfactory. It was quite disappointing. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Nelle

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple, STRONG brush!
customer_reviews.text: Now that summer is over, I feel I can honestly review this item. A great, simple wire brush used for my Weber Kettle grill. Did not scuff or scratch the grate, did not warp even when cleaning over heated coals, very easy to clean (don't forget that the bristles are SUPER STIFF and accidentally grab them while you're cleaning it - the bristles have a great way of finding their way under your nail, OUCH). Definitely recommend as it has not rusted after being left hanging off the grill for a few days and is a nice, sturdy brush to have.
customer_reviews.author: Decadent Tenshi

customer_reviews.title: Found the same one at a dollar store for a buck
customer_reviews.text: This IS a nice grill cleaning brush. However, I found a nearly identical one at a local dollar store for a buck. I would honestly check there first before spending 13X as much on this one, but that's just me!
customer_reviews.author: B. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great, portable bristled grill cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent accessory that accompanies any of your Weber grills portable or otherwise. Even though there are bristles this cleaner is made a high quality where the bristles will not fall off into or get stuck on your grilling surface. This cleaner is compact enough to easily travel with you for tailgates, trips to the beach or lake and camping.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schill

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Weber Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Weber 6494 and received the Weber 6494. Item shipped and sold by Amazon. The item is genuine and does not smell at all.
customer_reviews.author: ENYPDE

customer_reviews.title: Metal came off relatively fast.
customer_reviews.text: Got this because it was highly rated. I've used it maybe 10 times and I'm already getting metal strands off of it on the grill. I'm going to just get a cheap $1 one at the store next time without the wire. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron P.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this when our 15-yr-old brush gave up the ghost, breaking it's wooden handle after many years of weather exposure. We were worried that the handle would be too short, placing our hands too close to the heat, but since ATK recommended it, we gave it a try. It works really well, and the shorter length gives us more leverage. reducing the force needed to use it. Color us happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy ToesTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Veyry sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Using it on a gas grill grid rack is not as efficient as a wire charcoal grill grid. The gas rack has broad flat surfaces which this brush sot of skims over and fails to get into the grooves in between. It still does a decent job however but I find I need to rub it down with a damp towel afterwards. It performs much better on the wire grid of the charcoal grill. And who cleans these things?
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: What is this black magic?
customer_reviews.text: All of my other grill scrubbers gets caked with black soot and grease, this one stays clean all on its own. I don't know why. The cleaning capability is also very good, no complaints at all. So far, none of the bristles have fallen off or "laid down", so I'm very optimistic that this inexpensive grill brush will be useful for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: GreenBanana

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: From the picture it looks a little flimsy but this thing really scrapes off junk well. When you are done grilling and the surface is hot take 20 seconds and clean the grates. Easier right after cook.
customer_reviews.author: Murds

customer_reviews.title: Quality Grill Brush
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a good purchase. It does great cleaning my old grill although I’ve used brushes that appeared sharper. My old brush snapped and this model seems much sturdier. I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Briggs

customer_reviews.title: just right
customer_reviews.text: It is a solid medium-sized brush and clearly Weber brand. It is perfect for my needs and the right price. Don't need or want something huge. I pre-heat the grill to hot and then brush off and it is comfortable to use on a very hot grill. Bristles don't shed now and doubt they ever will. Pic to show size.
customer_reviews.author: KAPB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect short handled brush
customer_reviews.text: Weber makes a good universal product the the shortie brush is no exception. Cleaning the grated after use is much easier than the plastic brushes. The wire brush does not make the grille surface look shiny new, just enough residue is leftover to savor the flavor of the previous meal.
customer_reviews.author: The Hulls

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: After finding a piece of brush in my hamburger I decided to try to switch to this kind of a grill brush as there is no way for the bristles to come off in your food. It really is worthless to clean my grill. Just glides right over the particles. I LOVED my bristle brush - got my grill spotless. Not sure what I'm going to have to go to now, But this is going in the garbage
customer_reviews.author: linda616

customer_reviews.title: Item 6494 is definitely a WEBER brush
customer_reviews.text: The item number 6494 IS a definite Weber product. I got mine today and it clearly has Weber on the handle and came with two tags attached that verify this is a Weber item. It looks like there is another product similar to this which may be confusing people. If you want Weber be sure to order the 6494 item and not the 6493 item. I have not used it yet so cannot comment on that but just wanted to clear up any confusion about this item.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Dameron

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Weber quality
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting this inexpensive grill brush to work so well. Takes less pressure than my old long handle one and perfectly sized for the iron grates on my Weber Genesis. All that for $10. Don't know long term wear but not expecting it to last forever, just don't want shedding bristles.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Gets my Weber grill clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3 months ago and have been using in 2X per week. It had held up very well and gets are serious workout, considering how much we BBQ. The bristles are still unbent and holding up well. I would recommend this product and will buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have, keep in mind the length of the handle...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only kind of grill brush you should be buying. Takes the grime off with ease, after a good preheat. I run it over my stainless steel grates both parallel and perpendicular to the grate direction, and clears the black right off. The only downfall is the length of the handle. I wish I considered this when getting the product. I have a deep grill, so my hands get a little crispy when cleaning toward the back of the grill, but that’s my own fault.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great Brush!
customer_reviews.text: It is has a sturdy handle with a great finger hold indentation so it doesn't go flying out of your hand. Also a strap to wrap around your wrist for the same purpose as well as a use as a hanger. I like how you can turn it sideways to get the inside sections of the grates. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Easy grill cleaning brush, no scrapper needed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these last summer and just started using it after my regular brush/scrapper started to lose bristles. I never thought I'd get excited about a grill brush, but it makes my life easier. It's longer heavy duty bristles reach well in between and on the sides of the bottom edges of grill rungs so well that there's no need to use a scrapper trying to reach those tight spots, this does it all. The angled corners work well to get smaller spots. I really love it. Seems study and well made, though time will tell best.
customer_reviews.author: ConnieMH

customer_reviews.title: Clone
customer_reviews.text: How to weber brushes for years ! I needed a new one so I went to Amazon to get it , it came after a few months, over all I thought it like what I bought be for , until I put it next to the old one , it looks like a clone from u know were , has less wire in the brush does not clean as the original one .
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Best One I've Used
customer_reviews.text: This brush is very heavy duty, it should last a long time. Does a nice job cleaning the grill and it's easy to clean as long as I soak it in a heavy duty de-greaser solution for a few minutes. There has not been a single instance of it shedding bristles so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Eggo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to clean the grate with than a standard brush. It cleans up the grill quite nicely. Some of my satisfaction may have to do with the fact that I got a new grill at the same time but using this brush has definitely helped me keep the grates in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: wrhwrh

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have purchased 2 electric Weber grills. So I thought the name brand would be perfectly suited to get the job done. It's terrible. It does very little to get the grill grates clean and it requires a lot of elbow grease and time. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This brush is not long but fine for me. I think it is stronger being a little shorter than my last one. The design makes it easy to clean between the grate. I expect it will last a couple years but more for people who only grill occasionally. We grill 4-5 days a week year round.
customer_reviews.author: Potatohero

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning your grill
customer_reviews.text: Though it doesn’t look as impressive as some of the other brushes, this one cleans better than any other I’ve tried. The only drawback is the short handle, which puts your hand over some hot parts of the grill. Easily remedied by wearing an oven glove.
customer_reviews.author: TomK1111

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel Bristles are good.
customer_reviews.text: I like this grill brush for several reasons. The stainless steel bristles are wrapped with in the heavy metal spiral wire that forms the brush. The stainless steel bristles clean far better than the brass-ish or other metal bristles that seem to fall out of plastic brush handles. Used this brush to grill two-or-three weekends each month this summer. This fall the brush is as good as it was when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Or

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than the Alternatives
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Lanyard to hang on grill. Wide for quick cleaning...then turn sidewards to clean between the grates. Works well like most Weber products. Small Gripe: Wish wasn't made in China. Find a US manufacturer for $1 more.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Paul

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy but bristles will come off
customer_reviews.text: For the first month the brush work as advertised. Brush is strong, sturdy, and reliable. However after a month the bristles started to come off and stay on the grill. Therefore, I would no longer recommend this grill brush.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill Brush
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brush. The handle is not nearly as long as others I've used, so I have better leverage and can brush more effectively. For cleaning (there are no instructions) I soak it in mildly soapy water for a little while and rinse.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good grill brush
customer_reviews.text: This grill brush has a short handle which works well for me on my Weber Q 120 grill. The bristles are very thick wire that do not break off and do a good job of cleaning the grates between uses. This brush is very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Yosh

customer_reviews.title: Handy grill cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Nice grill cleaner. Hangs off the grill so available whenever I want to use it. I haven't cleaned it yet so I can't say how easy it is to clean. If I would be able to get into some of the smaller places easier I would have rated it a 5 for deep cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesotagal

customer_reviews.title: Good Product but the handle is too short
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is what you would expect form a Weber accessory, its very sturdy and well made. If I had to purchase it again I would go for the same model with a longer handle. The short handle makes it difficult to use, especially when the grill is already lit without burning yourself.
customer_reviews.author: M. Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a great grill brush
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for the right grill brush for years. Saw this one reviewed by America’s Test Kitchen. This is the best brush that I’ve used so far. Hand is a little close to the heat, but brush covers a wide area and gives you a lot of control. Easy to apply more pressure to stubborn areas without bending or breaking the brush.
customer_reviews.author: Jen and Will

customer_reviews.title: easy to use grill brush, but handle too short
customer_reviews.text: Should've bought the longer handle brush. Gets hot while trying to clean the grill between meats/fish, etc.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my one year old propane Weber Spirit grill. It works well and is very durable. The bristles are rigid and it seems like it will last a long time. I use it once before cooking AFTER the grill heats up, and then once right after cooking. I cannot get all the food off right after cooking, but it does a great job when I use it after the grill heats up for five minutes and the food turns black or grey. Also, it is not hurting the grilling surface. Don't think you will find a better one at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Big_Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: but my husband is pretty pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that this brush would be flimsy, but my husband is pretty pleased with it! We weren't even grilling for dinner last night, but after dinner he went out anyway just to test out this grill brush. He said the best part was that since it wasn't a flat brush that it could get in between the grates better than our old grill brush. I'm still a little skeptical on how long it will last, but I will update if any problems in the near future. I received this product at a discounted rate for an honest review.
customer_reviews.author: Ali G

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job of cleaning the grates on my new Weber ...
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of cleaning the grates on my new Weber grill. Just fire up the grill and scrub off the last thing you cooked before grilling your next meal. The only downside with this product is the length of the handle. I wish it was longer so you hand did not get as warm when you are scrubbing down the grill with this brush. Sure I could shut the grill off after heating it up and then turn it back on but who wants to do that every time?
customer_reviews.author: SanClementeJedi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and meant for getting the job done.The short handle is a plus it allows one to use wrist strength to put pressure on the grilling surface.It is sturdy so I don't think it will fall apart soon....I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: stephano

customer_reviews.title: Best Grill Brush To Date
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money. Well made and very sturdy allowing a lot of force to be applied to remove burnt stuff from the grill. Easily reaches to the back and sides of the grill and works fairly well between the grill gratings. Very pleased so far. Minimal bending of the bristles so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: It is a fairly good grill brush
customer_reviews.text: Overall, bought it to use on my weber 18 grill and it works well. Able to remove greese and build up burnt marks. For the price this is a fairly cheap grill brush. 4.5 stars due to being abit cheap feeling and not meant for deep grill cleaning. O
customer_reviews.author: tloppa

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Only negative about this is a small amount brush bristles will fall off after each use, so make sure you wipe down your grill grates afterwards. It does a good job of getting the burned food bits up. I've been using it for over 5 years and it still performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: I have had many grill cleaners which were cheap metal bristles eventually bend or break. This is the first grill cleaner I have used that cleans the grills, it is solid built, and has lasted a long time. Friends are amazed when I show them how will this grill cleaner works. Will definitely buy again and buy as gift for others.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and works well. It does a great job at a quick pre-barbecue cleaning. Not very deep prongs, so it does not get in very deep, but it does the trick. Good quality, and it is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Madere

customer_reviews.title: It starts shredding pretty fast
customer_reviews.text: It cleans nicely, but effectively into its second season, it has started shredding an abundance of little metal hair. We are very concerned about getting one of these in our food, and will use it no longer. Bad manufacture
customer_reviews.author: GiraffeNYC

customer_reviews.title: Nice brush for light use, not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Quality brush while it was a quality brush. bought in May for the grilling season, it is November and i'm buying a different brush for winter. would not recommend for use any more than every casual and with light force. bends easy and the wire bristles do not last a full year.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It works but requres some work
customer_reviews.text: I got a charcoal grill from Weber and decide to buy this Weber brush to clean the grill. It works but I have to make several passes with it. Maybe if the brush was denser, it would clean easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage, don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage, came with end piece missing and cracked handle. Photos are what it looked like right out of the package. Wasted $5.
customer_reviews.author: CAMOETO

customer_reviews.title: Great scrubber for Weber grill
customer_reviews.text: Much better than those flimsy things you get for $5 at Home Depot. This one costs more, but it doesn't tear up your Weber grill, and it gets things clean and doesn't fall apart. Loving it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Marc McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill Brush
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this grill brush on my Weber, and I couldn't be happier with it. My previous grill brush was too big, and I had trouble cleaning the back of the grill. This brush gets easily cleans the entire grill, and it gets between the grill bars better than a standard square brush.
customer_reviews.author: T. McCall

customer_reviews.title: So Fresh and So Clean
customer_reviews.text: If you love brushing grills and getting them really clean and then enjoying delicious food off of that grill, you will most likely love this delightful and efficient little tool. I apologize for the length of the previous sentence. Way too long! It was worth it, though. This really is a nice brush and I think you will be delighted to start scrubbing your grill with it.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Schinkten

customer_reviews.title: Safer than my old brush
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an older brush, from which the bristles were coming loose. I realized after reading a consumer report somewhere, that loose wire bristles falling onto your grill posed a potential health problem. The bristles in this brush are contained in the twisted wire loop that makes the handle, instead of just being imbedded into a paddle. Oh, and it works really well, removing old residue from the grill...
customer_reviews.author: David M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: The way to go!
customer_reviews.text: I've seen these for years in the stores and never thought they could be better than a traditional brush, I was wrong! This is the best brush I've ever used in the 20 years I've been grilling! I like the 12in. size to, nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: This is a truly excellent grill brush and it's not expensive.
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST GRILL BRUSH that I have ever used. And it's inexpensive. I grill food on my Weber Genesis more often that Donald Trump interrupts Hillary Clinton. I've used probably six other types of grill brushes, many of which were more expensive. I will keep buying this brush and if they discontinue it I will be sadface.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Shorter handle but still cleans well.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the same brush as the one a bought a couple years ago. The handle is annoyingly a few inches shorter, which is not great on a hot grill. It still cleans every nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hepokoski

customer_reviews.title: I love this brush.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this brush. It's sturdy, it's designed perfectly to get into hard to reach places on the grill grates, it has a little leather cord thing to hang on my grill. I have used it 4 times in the last week and there are no signs of wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: If you've got a grill, get one, just get one
customer_reviews.text: I'd had grill cleaning brush for a numbers and while it was still working well I decided to try this brush. I'm glad I did, with a wider brush and sturdy bristles, it does a great job cleaning the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M

customer_reviews.title: The handle is too short unless you are scrubbing a 4 inch pan
customer_reviews.text: After using this grill brush I have no more hair left on my fingers or my arms unless you are scrubbing a pan that might be 4 inches round I would buy one with an extended handle. Also, this did a horrible job scrubbing my grill after cooking steaks while it was still warm
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Works well, and just be careful.
customer_reviews.text: It’s what the mfr. recommends. Works fine. Consumer Reports reminded me that it’s important to wipe down the surface after brushing to make sure no metal bristles remain.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grill brush.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and at a decent price. If one is concerned about bristles left on the grates which I haven't noticed - I would recommend wiping the grates down with a paper towel afterwards. Paper towels really help keep the grates clean.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Rusted in the first week
customer_reviews.text: First use was great. Then it rusted within one week. However, we left this brush outside, under our grill cover, which may not have been the smartest move. Tried to wipe it and also rinse it off, but it still left a rust trail on my Weber grill. It went in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Brush for cleaning all grills
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because a non stainless brush can cause rust on a stainless grill grate. I use to have one with the mesh ball on the end and it would always leave little flakes everywhere. The bristles on this brush are very secure and the handle feels great in the hand while giving plenty of leverage for that stubborn burnt on barbeque sauce.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I get this a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: Always bought the cheap dollar store ones and decided on this one after reading the reviews. So much easier to clean my grill now. Gets places my old brick couldn’t
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: Not practical for cleaning large grills. Handle is too short.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent grill brush, get the longer handle
customer_reviews.text: It's a grill brush, it works. I like it better than my wood weber grill brush since you can hold it at any angle. -0.5 stars since the short handle makes it difficult to clean the whole grill without burning your hand, but that's also my fault for not buying the longer handle. Additionally I would prefer more bristles along the brush, -0.5 starts for that. I'd buy it again, but I'll go with the longer handle next time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the crud off of the grill
customer_reviews.text: This scrubber is a champ. I wish the handle were about 4" longer, but it does really get into the grill and scrape off the burnt bits. I'm taking extra good care of this and rinsing after each use. I'm hopeful that this will last a full year.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Wing

customer_reviews.title: Get the longer version
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these previously, but didn't realize they had a shorter version. This 12 inch version is way too short and go with the longer model.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Perkins

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: This brush does a very good job cleaning my Weber grates. It is very effective. The brush is sturdy as well. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Cleans our grill, but handle is too short and feels flimsy. Expect a little more from Weber.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a very rusty no name brand grill brush from T.J. Maxx. It cleans our Weber Spirit E-210 nicely, though as some others have noted I wish the handle was longer and more durable. It does feel a little on the flimsy side and I am wondering how long it will last. The short handle also leaves my husband with some singed knuckle hairs when cleaning all the way to the back when the grill is on.
customer_reviews.author: LinwoodMommy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bristles
customer_reviews.text: Best grill brush I have ever bought! Does not leave wire particles on your grill Perfect size for always hanging on the side of your grill
customer_reviews.author: Beachbum Customer

customer_reviews.title: not sure
customer_reviews.text: I love WEber bbques! will forever brag about them, so I purchased the same brand grill cleaner.... it's fine, but no better than the ones I've gotten in dollar stores for way less... (sorry Weber).. just saying
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's wide so I can do half a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was wary after some people said it wasn't stiff enough. I can see why but I haven't really had a problem since I clean the grill off while it's still warm. I like that it's wide so I can do half a grill plate at a time. You can turn it sideways to get between the grates with the edge, too. I like that it's short, for easier control and not so hard on my wrist. When it wears out I'll probably come back and see if it's still around.
customer_reviews.author: jder

customer_reviews.title: Item as described, It's made by Weber
customer_reviews.text: Not a whole lot I can say. Item as described, It's made by Weber. I bought this one because I wanted the shorter handle. I will buy again when it wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Villanman

customer_reviews.title: Best grill brush yet!
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected! I don't think I will go back to the flat head grill brushes after using this. The bristles are held in the head of this better just because of how its made. It does a better job of cleaning off the remnants from the last grilling session that a flat headed brush does. I have a small grill, so the shorter handle is just fine with me. If you have a large grill, you may want the longer handled version however to avoid cooking your arm too much when scraping. You always want to scrap you grill when its hot, so let the grill get up to temperature, then scrape it down!
customer_reviews.author: Brian W. King

customer_reviews.title: durability
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a weber grill cover in 2016. Stored the grill with cover on under a covered deck with no sunshine. The cover ripped apart at 2 of the seams. Thought it should last longer since it was not out in the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Janny

customer_reviews.title: Weber Quality
customer_reviews.text: Weber quality is high across the board, apparently extending to this brush. I like how the bristles get between the slats in the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lees

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Grill Brush
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy little steel wire brush does a wonderful job of cleaning the cast iron grates on my Weber grill. Well worth the few extra $ over a cheap version.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Pruett

customer_reviews.title: Great Brush
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sturdy brush. I use it several times a week and I am on my second season without any issues. I purchased several of these for my kids and they like it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon G.

customer_reviews.title: Not useful on electric grill
customer_reviews.text: Bought to clean Weber 1400 electric grill - really doesn't do a very good job of cleaning the grates - easier to just remove them and hand wash - product itself seems well made but just doesn't do what I need it to - already in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a good buy. It's wide enough to clean a decent portion of the grates and so far it has held up well (about a month of use). The bristles are strong enough to get off tough residue from the grill as well. My only beef is that it is a bit short (although the 12 inches are fully disclosed in the description) and therefore it's a bit harder to get leverage while using it. But all in all I am happy with the purchase for the price and would likely buy it again if need be
customer_reviews.author: That Helpful Dad

customer_reviews.title: wide brush with solid clean
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. Weber (now) has another version with a longer handle for deeper (further back) grills. This works way better than small handheld ones I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: MBS

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Tried a bunch of other grille brushes but this one does the job and seems sturdy enough to last a while. When this one "goes", I'll buy another .
customer_reviews.author: Rich P

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and poorly made
customer_reviews.text: After using 4-5 times on new Weber grill, I examined the cooking surface and found two sharp wire bristles waiting to stick to food and be ingested by me or my family. Would like to return but now past the return window. Disappointed with this Weber product. Expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Barbecue Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in every way but wish the handle was longer. Not that the handle length is a problem, but the same one I had before had a longer handle and somehow I preferred it.
customer_reviews.author: JAFAA

customer_reviews.title: Weber grill brush
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go along with the Weber Grill we bought for my husband as a gift. He loves it and says he cleans the grill better than any other brush he’s had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Good brush
customer_reviews.text: It works good. I just preheat the grill then give it a quick scrub with this and everything comes clean fairly easily. Only problem is the wife tells me she can’t figure out how to use it...but I think she’s playing me.
customer_reviews.author: Amm0622

customer_reviews.title: Easier than the longer handled version to use......... in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I prefer the shorter handled to clean my grill / grates, but if you've hot a very hot surface you're cleaning, then the longer handled one will save your fingers and hand. For smaller, portable grills, it's really perfect.
customer_reviews.author: LwosTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill brush for my gas grill
customer_reviews.text: After my last grill brush went mysteriously missing, I decided to give this one a try since it’s primarily for my gas grill. Solid construction and with the angled edges gets into the nooks and crannies of my grates. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M

product_meta.title: Weber 6494 12-Inch 3-Sided Grill Brush, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackWhether you cook over charcoal or gas, this is a must-have tool for keeping grill grates free of food debris. Easily cleans hard-to-reach spaces between the cooking grates rods and in tight spaces at the edges of the cooking grates. Stainless steel bristles are extra thick for a longer life. Ergonomic handle Helps with grip.
feature_bullets: Wide brush head cleans large surfaces quickly and efficiently
Shorter sides can be used for cleaning edges and dislodging debris between grates
Thick stainless steel bristles resist wear
Ergonomic handle provides control and leverage when cleaning dirty cook grates
